item.title: Synctera, Unit, and Treasury Prime execs discuss the future of BaaS at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description:
The serious, long-term negative impact of the bankruptcy of banking-as-a-service (BaaS) fintech Synapse will be significant “on all of fintech, especially consumer-facing services,” one observer has said. In the wake of that company’s collapse, other startups in the space are working hard to prove that not all BaaS are created equal. As partners to fintechs, […]

item.title: Tezi is building an AI agent for hiring managers
item.dc:creator: Ron Miller
item.description:
AI agents are all the rage right now, and Tezi, an early stage startup is working on one to help HR teams find the perfect candidates for a job opening. The startup claims this bot will sift through resumes to find the ones that match the hiring criteria, find time on the recruiter’s calendar to […]

item.title: Sybill raises $11M for its AI assistant that helps salespeople reduce administrative burden
item.dc:creator: Kate Park, Jagmeet Singh
item.description:
Sybill, a startup that has built an AI assistant specifically for sales reps, has raised $11 million in a Series A round led by Greycroft.

item.title: Date Like Goblins, a new dating platform, allows users to virtually date and play video games
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Date Like Goblins is geared toward the gaming community and allows users to connect through voice chat while playing video games.

item.title: Leaf helps farms decipher the troves of data they generate
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
Farms produce a lot of data. From machines to irrigation systems, farms generate a lot of information that could be helpful to both them and the companies that serve them. Traditionally this data has been siloed across different formats making it hard to read and build off of. Leaf is trying to change that. New […]

item.title: Checkly tests software by mimicking the way people use it
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Checkly helps devs get signals about an app's performance and downtime, offering a set of subscription-based synthetic monitoring tools.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Travel startup Mindtrip’s new feature lets you build an itinerary from a screenshot, YouTube or TikTok video
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
You can even upload a screenshot of a ticket, or a list of cities you are visiting and ask Mindtrip's assistant to suggest places to visit, bars and restaurants.

The startup has raised $21.5 million to build more of its machines and deploy them throughout the U.S.

item.title: Lightrun launches its AI debugger to help developers fix their production code

item.description:
Lightrun also on Wednesday disclosed an $18 million SAFE round it raised last year, bringing Lightrun's total funding to date to $45 million.

item.title: Threads now highlights relevant trending topics above posts

item.description:
Threads users in the U.S. can now see a label that highlights related trending topics above posts.

item.title: Bumble and Hinge allowed stalkers to pinpoint users’ locations down to 2 meters, researchers say
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
Badoo, Bumble, Grindr, happn, Hinge and Hily all had the same flaw that could have helped a malicious user to identify the near-exact location of another user.

item.title: Tiger Global partner Alex Cook to leave firm, sources say
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Alex Cook, a partner at Tiger Global who oversaw some of its largest fintech investments and India deals, is departing the firm after a tenure of nearly seven years, three people familiar with the matter told TechCrunch.  Cook has briefed multiple people around him about his departure news in recent days, although he hasn’t explained […]

item.title: OpenAI endorses Senate bills that could shape America’s AI policy
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
A lot of AI bills are flying around Congress these days, and OpenAI is throwing its weight behind some of them. OpenAI endorsed three Senate bills on Tuesday which could shape the federal government’s stance on artificial intelligence. One of the bills – the Future of AI Innovation Act – would formally authorize the United […]

item.title: Lineaje raises $20M to help organizations combat software supply chain threats
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
The software supply chain faces threats from all sides. A 2024 report by the Ponemon Institute found that over half of organizations have experienced a software supply chain attack, with 54% having experienced one within the past year. Supply chain attacks typically target services from third-party vendors or open source software that make up a […]

item.title: SEC charges BitClout founder Nader Al-Naji with fraud; says proceeds paid for L.A. mansion, gifts
item.dc:creator: Margaux MacColl
item.description:
The founder of once-hyped crypto startup BitClout is facing trouble. On Tuesday, the SEC charged him with fraud and other offenses.

item.title: OpenAI releases ChatGPT’s hyperrealistic voice to some paying users
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
OpenAI began rolling out ChatGPT’s Advanced Voice Mode on Tuesday, giving users their first access to GPT-4o’s hyperrealistic audio responses. The alpha version will be available to a small group of ChatGPT Plus users today, and OpenAI says the feature will gradually roll out to all Plus users in the fall of 2024. When OpenAI […]

item.title: Spain’s antitrust watchdog fines Booking.com nearly $450M for unfair terms and restricting rivals
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
The CNMC opened an investigation of Booking.com back in October 2022, following complaints by the Spanish Association of Hotel Managers and the Regional Hotel Association of Madrid.

item.title: Controversial internet bill KOSA passed by Senate
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
The Kids Online Safety Act (KOSA) has passed in the Senate after Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) pushed the internet bill to a vote. Proposed in 2022, KOSA requires that online platforms take reasonable steps to protect users from harm, and could become the most significant children’s online safety legislation to take effect since COPPA. […]

item.title: Spotify expands lyrics access for free users
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Back in May, Spotify quietly started putting lyrics behind a paywall, limiting free users to lyrics for three songs per month. The move was a bid to push more users to pay for the service. After receiving numerous complaints, the company is now expanding the monthly limit. Starting today, Spotify is raising the limit on […]
